intro: Garnotia ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's garnet, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant floral display. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Garnotia ledermannii is considered a species of conservation concern.
